text: Since most studies show that young adults have the highest Covid19 incidence -- and can rarely get quite sick themselves -- strongly support these mandates, which are increasing among colleges/universities. Students also can be a key source of local spread in communities. https://t.co/qjRf3J69fH https://t.co/yKwboZh4pH

Important work by colleagues Drs. Scott Dryden-Peterson, @OjikutuBisola, and others, documenting disparities between Covid19 risk and vaccination rates in MA. Hoping this unfortunate trend can be corrected. @bwh_id @MGHBWHIDFellows  https://t.co/zvmbNx9aDl

Due to similarities between the J&J and AZ covid vax clotting syndromes, there is speculation that it relates to the adenovirus vector vaccine strategy. The Sputnik vaccine uses 2 different adenovirus shots. Any post-trial safety data available? https://t.co/SmIIsXYQib https://t.co/8qzHJTOjJB

@GermHunterMD Benefits outweigh the toxicity, but it's no longer as friendly a place. Oh well ... life during covid-time. Would love to see your final talk -- the last one was brilliant, I still refer to it!
Watch this skillful one-minute video on covid vaccines by @google. Will it convince people who are undecided to get the vaccine? Or does it just make us feel good? Latest: https://t.co/TY3VLghQO8

Small study (stopped early), and open label, but nonetheless very welcome data on a safe, readily available, and inexpensive intervention that reduces risk of Covid19 disease progression. Eagerly await confirmatory studies. https://t.co/dYn77wL0R1

These numbers are unbelievably great.

The staggering success of San Francisco in controlling covid will I hope provide us all with lessons for future pandemics.
